intro: Tanacetum abrotanifolium, commonly known as field chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, gray-green leaves and yellow-orange flower heads. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Tanacetum abrotanifolium is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used historically in traditional medicine.
